channel.title: Suggestion: Java Games Development Contest
channel.description:
I like competitions, people like competitions, everyone likes competitions!
My suggestion is that we have some sort of Java Games Dev competition where the goal is to create a game based on a specific theme in a given short timeframe (a few days max).
Suggested rules would be:
[ul][li]The theme must be abstract to promote creative thinking [/li] [li]Only allowed to use code written by yourself, no snippets from anywhere else[/li] [li]All art assets must be created by the contestant[/li] [li]Only the JRE standard API is allowed, no third party libraries[/li] [li]For art assets, any tool may be used (if you want music/sound effects, you create them yourself)[/li] [li]Live streaming (http://www.livestream.com/) of the project development process is a plus, since it simplifies enforcing the rules[/li] [li]Source code must be released as open source when completed, and all resources such as art/music must become public domain[/li][/ul]
The purpose of this would be for one, to create and be creative, secondly to learn from both your own experiences and from other people's projects, and more importantly, have fun!
A prize for the winner isn't neccessary, but if people are interested it can be arranged in one way or another (perhaps something as simple as a custom badge?)
So, if anyone else thinks this is a good idea, tell me!

item.title: Suggestion: Java Games Development Contest
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“boomer216, post:86, topic:359122”][quote author=chri5 link=topic=455613.msg3451037#msg3451037 date=1293749232]
what a stupid idea, all of the games will have the same idea

unless you’re talking about a large repository of pixel art, which you probably won’t find legally
[/quote]

If you read the OP, then you’d realize the games ARE supposed to have the same idea.
“where the goal is to create a game based on a specific theme in a given short timeframe”[/quote]
theme, not game idea. looking at ludum dare you’ll see that while many of the games share the same theme, they don’t share the exact idea.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

abraham2119:

sounds good, although i did like the idea of recording the entire development stage as proof that everything was done from scratch

In a time-limited contest that would be important, but in a size-limited contest you probably aren’t going to use 3rd party code because it would be too big.

item.title: Suggestion: Java Games Development Contest
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Since this is 9999 dead mainly because nobody has the time to work 2 days straight I suggest we change the competition into one of those java 4k challenges in which all participants must create a game under 4kb after being compressed into a jar executable.

The rules would be relatively simple:

  1. The jar must be under 4k (hurrrrrrrrr)
  2. Cannot use any external libraries or resources (so getting gfx from a web server is forbidden).
  3. Must be able to run offline (similar to 2.)

Unlike the current contest this could run over a longer period of time: perhaps 2 months. I personally believe this is a true challenge of ones programming ability since you have to cram a lot of shit into a really small space. In my opinion, the 48 hour challenge is more of a “who is saddest/can stay up for 48 hours” contest.

It’s truly amazing what some people have achieved with 4kb using java which has quite a big overhead. I was really impressed by FortessFall4k which is basically a simplified version of angry birds.

Read full topic
